event: 11th Annual Poverty Bay Blues and Brews Fest
info: The 2021 Poverty Bay Blues & Brews Fest will feature four blues performances and dozens of craft-beers from Northwest beer makers. 21 and over only. Early bird tickets on sale now.
location: Des Moines Beach Park, 22030 Cliff Ave. S., Des Moines

info: Ultimate played at the highest levels against teams in the AUDL West Division. An interactive event for all ages with food trucks, bake sale, give-aways, half time games and post game autographs on the field.
location: Memorial Stadium, 401 Fifth Ave. N., Seattle

info: Socially-distanced, professionally-timed race in Magnuson Park. Run or walk a mile, 5K or 10K. Go home with a medal, shirt and sponsored goodies. Funds support Operation Ward 57's mission to support wounded veterans and their families.
location: Swimming Beach at Magnuson Park, 6505 N.E. 65th St., Seattle

event: Seattle Marathon Summer 5K/10K & Kids Fun Run
info: Bring the whole family (and Fido too!) and enjoy a run around the Seward Park peninsula.There will be prizes for top finishers, and medals and race shirts for all participants.
location: Seward Park, 5900 Lake Washington Blvd. S., Seattle

info: Two-day garden party with vendors, raffle prizes, entertainment, a "plantini lounge" and more. Ticket cost includes tote bags, drink and raffle tickets, promotional items and coupons from local downtown Renton businesses.
location: Renton Pavilion Events Center, 233 Burnett Ave. S., Renton

event: Saturday Market at the Port of Ilwaco
info: Market featuring more than 70 vendors along the pedestrian-only Waterfront Way overlooking the Port of Ilwaco Marina and Baker Bay. Find regional produce, baked goods, a selection of local plants and homemade arts and crafts.
category: Art, Exhibits and Expos, Markets, Food and Drink
location: Port of Ilwaco, 165 Howerton Ave., Ilwaco

info: A week-long kite celebration and competition held annually during the third full week of August that draws famous kite fliers from all around the world and thousands of spectators, many of whom participate in the fun with their own kite flying adventures.
location: Bolstad West, Long Beach

info: Festival with music in the park, food, vendors, parade, beer garden and more.
category: Festivals and Parades, Food and Drink
location: Riverfront Park, Raymond, WA

info: Annual sand-sculpting event in Long Beach open to sand castle builders of every age and skill level.
category: Art, Exhibits and Expos, Festivals and Parades
location: Bolstad Beach Approach, Bolstad West, Long Beach

info: The 45th Annual yacht race begins in Ilwaco and ends in Port Angeles. Participants travel from the mouth of the Columbia River, up the Washington coast. The race tests sailing, navigation and tactical skills as well as endurance.
location: Port of Ilwaco, WA to Port Angeles, WA

info: 45-minute narrated boat tour of Lake Union aboard the Fremont Avenue. Learn about Seattle's history and what makes Lake Union a unique place. Dog-friendly. Ice cream and other snacks available. Leaves on the hour from Lake Union Park in front of the Museum of History and Industry. Sundays year round, Saturdays June 19- Aug. 28. No advance ticket sales on Sunday. Group reservations available on Saturdays.
location: Lake Union Park, 860 Terry Ave. N., Seattle

info:
90th Anniversary of Women Painters of Washington showing 80 paintings by 48 local artists. This show celebrates a diversity of styles by current members and honors its 90th year promoting professional artists from across Washington State.
Juried by David Martin of Cascade Museum. In-person or virtual.
location: Columbia Center, 701 Fifth Ave., Seattle

info: Join the Binaytara Foundation's annual Cancer Climb for a hike on Mount Si or Little Si (depending on your experience level) to raise funds to fight cancer. Registered participants will get a T-shirt, water and snacks, plus entry into drawings for prizes like Mariners tickets, REI gear, and more.
location: Mount Si & Little Si, S.E. Mt. Si Rd., North Bend

info: Festival with summer games, crowning the King & Queen of Summer, puppetry, magic, crafts, archery and minstrelsy.
category: Art, Exhibits and Expos, Festivals and Parades, Other
location: Camlann Medieval Village, 10320 Kelly Rd. N.E., Carnation

info: Fair with knightly combat, puppetry, music, crafts, archery and minstrels.
category: Art, Exhibits and Expos, Festivals and Parades, Other
location: Camlann Medieval Village, 10320 Kelly Rd. N.E., Carnation

info: Festival with puppetry, crafts, English longbow archery, villager demonstrations of every day life and minstrels.
category: Art, Exhibits and Expos, Festivals and Parades, Other
location: Camlann Medieval Village, 10320 Kelly Rd. N.E., Carnation

info: Virtual rubber ducky race presented by Bellevue Kiwanis. All proceeds are directed toward the feeding programs of Nourishing Networks, Salvation Army’s hot meals and Jubilee Reach’s groceries for families. Buy tickets to sponsor numbered ducks from any Bellevue Kiwanian. Win cash prizes of $300, $200 and $100.
category: Aquatic Activities, Fourth of July, Other
location: bellevuewakiwanis.org

info: Event with olympic and ultra-sprint distance triathlon/duathlon/aquabike, marathon, half marathon, 5K/10K, half marathon trail run, bike tours and kids races.
location: Long Beach Peninsula, WA

event: Woodinville Garden Club Tour of Gardens 2021
info: Self-drive tour of five private gardens in the Woodinville/Redmond area. The theme this year is "Living with Nature." Tickets sold online and at local nurseries.
location: Woodinville/Redmond

event: Whisker Me Away! MEOW Luau 2.0 - Fine Wines & Felines 2021
info: Virtual auction and livestream program to benefit the animals of MEOW Cat Rescue. Online auction begins Aug. 7 with livestream program and catered box meal available for delivery (limited area) or pick up at shelter in Kirkland on Aug. 14.
location: auction.meowcatrescue.org

event: It's About Time Writers' Reading Series
info: Virtual multi-genre reading series in partnership with Seattle Public Library featuring craft talks, new and experienced writers and three-minute open mic. Register online.
location: us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZctdeqhpjMjGNbE8tJwEcVviBnC09uWb51-

info: Car show hosted by the Puget Sound Olds Club.
location: Frances Anderson Center, 700 Main St., Edmonds

info: Hop on an Argosy ferry boat for a quick five minute ferry ride to Jetty Island to enjoy the sun, play in the sand and swim in the water. Reserve a seat and pay for ferry tickets online.
category: Aquatic Activities, Exercise (Runs, hiking, etc.), Other
location: 10th Street and W. Marine View Dr., Everett
price: $3/person, free/kids ages two or younger, parking fees vary

event: Sun, Set, & Spike Grass Volleyball Tournament
info: Kirkland Parks and Community Services is hosting the first Sun, Set, & Spike Grass Volleyball Tournament at Lee Johnson Field at Peter Kirk Park. There will be a round robin tournament on Aug. 25 and Aug. 27. There will be a COED and Women's division. COED teams must have two men and two women to participate. This is a four on four tournament and all levels are welcome! Team managers will register their team under the division of their choice. Game times will be sent out one week before the tournament starts. The winning team from each division will win a prize! Register online or over the phone at 425-587-3336.
location: Lee Johnson Field, 202 Third St., Kirkland

info: 5K family run/walk with proceeds going to the Mesothelioma Applied Research Foundation to support patients and their families, provide research grants, and create national awareness. Mesothelioma is a cancer caused by asbestos exposure. In memory of Dick Dyhrman, Bud Hatley, Bob Stewart and other Washington residents who have died from Mesothelioma. The event can be completed any time during the week of July 1-July 4th. Participants can take thier time and run/walk a course of their choosing.
location: runsignup.com/Race/WA/FederalWay/MilesforMeso5kVirtual

info: In-person summer camps return in 2021 for ages three and up. Camps are 100% outdoors and include soccer, tennis, ultimate, art, equestrian, farm & nature, and more. All camps offer smaller camp size to allow for physical distancing, and will include enhanced safety and cleaning protocols. Full and half-day options available for each of the week-long camps.
location: locations vary

event: Skyhawks Youth Sports Camps - Tukwila Parks and Recreation
info: Skyhawks Sports Academy is offering a variety of half day and full day sports camp programs where children can discover and develop athletic skills and social values, such as teamwork, respect and sportsmanship.
location: Tukwila Community Center, 12424 42nd Ave. S., Tukwila

event: Seattle Tempest/Cascades Ultimate Camp - Tukwila Parks and Recreation
info: Ultimate is a non-contact sport played with a flying disk. This week-long camp is tailored for ages 8-13 and all experience levels are encouraged to attend. Learn from coaches from the Seattle Tempest and Seattle Cascades.
location: Tukwila Community Center, 12424 42nd Ave. S., Tukwila

info: A Japanese-Buddhist festival that honors friends and family who passed away.The 89th Seattle Bon Odori will be virtual. Via YouTube, visitors will see traditional Japanese dancing, food & drink recipes, community messages and entertainment provided by Two Story Zori, a local Hawaiian Island Reggae band. In addition, there will be food, packaged cocktail ingredient and merchandise for drive-thru pickup on Saturday, July 17.
location: seattlebetsuin.com/vsbo21-home

info: Car show hosted by the North Cascade Street Rod Association with awards, a raffle and more. Masks and social distancing required.
location: La Conner Middle School Soccer Field, 305 N. Sixth St., La Conner

info: Candle-lit lanterns will once again float across Green Lake at From Hiroshima to Hope, Seattle’s annual peace event honoring the victims of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki and all victims of war and violence. This August marks the 76th anniversary of the atomic bombings. The event concludes with a lantern floating ceremony. The family program includes speaker Seattle Times columnist Naomi Ishisaka, emcee and poet, Larry Matsuda, and the popular Japanese-American drum performance group, Seattle Kokon Taiko.
location: Green Lake's northwest shore
